thread.title: Yankees' executive may sway Jeff Samardzija signing, report says
thread.title_full: Yankees' executive may sway Jeff Samardzija signing, report says

author: Ryan Hatch | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Yankees' executive may sway Jeff Samardzija signing, report says
text:
CBS' Jon Heyman writes this week that a New York executive may make it happen: 
"Former Cubs GM Jim Hendry, a Yankees executive, is a big voice in the organization now, leading to even more speculation Samardzija will be on the agenda," Heyman writes. "Hendry was the one who plucked Samardzija out of Notre Dame, and gave him a $10 million signing bonus." 
Hendry's position is a special assistant to general manager Brian Cashman. PLUS : 5 Yankees things to actually look forward to in 2016 
Samardzja, 30, finished 2015 with a 4.96 ERA in 32 starts and 214.0 innings, allowing the most hits (228) and home runs (29) in the league. 
The righty would join a Yankees staff consisting of many uncertaintiesâ€”Masahiro Tanaka, Michael Pineda, Nathan Eovaldi, and CC Sabathia all spent time on the disabled list in 2015.
